moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 exd4 4. Nxd4 d: 12. Nh5!, good move, eliminating the threat on the Black's king side
moves.13. Qe3 Nxf4 14. Qxf4 h6 15. Bd3: 15. Bd3?, lack of concentration from the white, loses his queen for free
moves.20. Rxd8 Rxd8 21. Bxb7 Rb8 22. Bc6: 22. Bc6, the only move, anything else loses a piece because Qxa4! cannot be answered because of the pin of the white pawn at a3
moves.22... Qa6: 22. ... Qa6!, chasing for the free piece
moves.23. Nc5 Qc4: 23. ... Qc6?, loses the chance of winning a piece because the lack of concentration too
31. Qb4!, the trap is set for mate here and the will coordinated forces of the black make it difficult to get away
